ygData.messageBody:
Do you want stupid tinkered pets or do you want the Hole finished?
Personally I prefer a new zone
----- Original Message -----
From: <jcs0001@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2000 6:48 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Re: The Creation of Clockwork Machines


> Good GOD.. 2 Million a MONTH???
>
> You would think that they could Really afford to flesh this thing
> out then.
>
> Clockworks couldn't BE a trade system. They would be PETS nothing more,
> nothing less. Although they could be very POWERFUL pets, that would
> offset the fact that a MASTER TINKERER (MT) wouldn't have available to him
> the amenities of other classes that can have pets. MASTER TINKERERS
> wouldn't have the ability to cast spells, although through their
> creations could approximate the effect of spells through their Tinkers.
>
> The issue of these things unbalancing the world through their sale
> wouldn't BE a factor because all that would have to be done is make the
> life of these Tinkers finite. Rebreathers and Aqualungs for example
> would disintegrate FASTER than they do now if not being used by a
> MASTER TINKERER. This would be due to an implied ability of the MT to
> perform the required maintenance on the objects he creates. (No ACTUAL
> maintenance would have to be performed mind you, just having the object
> in one's inventory would be enough to extend the life of a Tinker)
>
>

> > > Im talking Clockwork Pets Here.

> > > If the all the components of a corpse can be
> > > collected, then there
> > > should be corresponding brainboxes to them, and we
> > > should be able to
> > > create them.
> > >
> > > If people cry out "UNBALANCING!" then we should
> > > remind them that it
> > > takes THOUSANDS of plat to Level our skills, and
> > > that the components
> > > to the brainboxes for these things should be
> > > difficult to quest by
> > > corresponding to the Creature being Clockworked.
> > >
> > > (SC) Small Creatures : Brainboxes can be bought
> > > or made for 5-20pp
> > > (LC) Large Creatures : 25-55pp
> > > (SH) Small Humanoid : 60-125pp
> > > (LH) Large Humanoid : 130-250pp

> > > The large gap between VLH's and VLC's is because
> > > Ogres and Trolls
> > > wouldnt do NEAR as much damage as Krackens and

> > >

> > > dime a dozen.
> > >
> > > Of course the actual costs and quest difficulties
> > > can be hashed over
> > > for balance, but this shouldnt cause any unbalancing
> > > issues if done
> > > right.
> > >
> > > Verant is being PAID to do it right, and keep us
> > > PAYING people happy.
> > >
> > > To make things more balanced, Tinkering could be
> > > made a Race-Specific
> > > Specialty-Class. This would work by keeping
> > > Tinkering a Gnome trait
> > > available to ALL GNOMES, but those Gnomes that
> > > choose to become a
> > > MASTER-TINKERER would have to coose to do so as a
> > > CLASS just like a
> > > Magic-User has to choose what type of caster he
> > > wants to be, a Gnome
> > > would have to choose between being a normal class of
> > > Gnome, or a
> > > MASTER-TINKERER.
> > >
> > > Gnomes that do this would be able to create the more
> > > elaborate
> > > Tinkers such as the VLC's and VLH's and the more
> > > sought-after pieces
> > > of equipment.
> > >
> > > If you are asking about the balance of having
> > > characters with Pet
> > > Clockwork Dragons or Krackens', then remember. These
> > > MASTER-TINKERERS
> > > have to spend hundreds of plat just to earn the
> > > SKILL to create these
> > > creatures, and then spend the time to collect the
> > > pieces of these
> > > creatures (How many dragons do you think it would
> > > take to kill, just
> > > to collect every single dragon piece? Thats a LOT of
> > > WORK), and then
> > > the pure plat and time to collect the pieces to
> > > thier brainbox!
> > >
> > > What if it fails? We are talking possibly 3-4 WEEKS
> > > Real time in lost
> > > Plat and Time, all in a blink of an eye.
> > >
> > > Sure, there would be lots of Clockwork rats and

> > > cares? My Enchanter's First-level apparition can
